im.tox.jtoxcore

Class JTox<F extends ToxFriend>

  • java.lang.Object
    • im.tox.jtoxcore.JTox<F>
  • Type Parameters:
    F - Friend type for this JTox instance

    public class JTox<F extends ToxFriend>
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main wrapper class for the tox library. It contains wrapper methods for everything in the public API provided by tox.h
    Author:
    sonOfRa

    • Field Detail

      • TOX_MAX_STATUSMESSAGE_LENGTH

        public static final int TOX_MAX_STATUSMESSAGE_LENGTH
        Maximum length of a status message in Bytes. Non-ASCII characters take multiple Bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TOX_MAX_NICKNAME_LENGTH

        public static final int TOX_MAX_NICKNAME_LENGTH
        Maximum length of a nickname in Bytes. Non-ASCII characters take multiple Bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JTox

        public JTox(FriendList<F> friendList,
    CallbackHandler<F> handler)
     throws ToxException
        Creates a new instance of JTox and stores the pointer to the internal struct in messengerPointer.
        Parameters:
        friendList - the friendlist to use with this instance
        handler - the callback handler for this instance
        Throws:
        ToxException - when the native call indicates an error

      • JTox

        public JTox(byte[] data,
    FriendList<F> friendList,
    CallbackHandler<F> handler)
     throws ToxException
        Creates a new instance of JTox and stores the pointer to the internal struct in messengerPointer. Also attempts to load the specified byte array into this instance.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to load for the new tox instance
        friendList - friend list to use with this tox instance
        handler - callback handler to use with this instance
        Throws:
        ToxException - when the native call indicates an error

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
                            throws ToxException
        Get our own address
        Returns:
        our client's address
        Throws:
        ToxException - when the instance has been killed or an error occurred when trying to get our address

        Returns:

        public void setStatusMessage(java.lang.String message)
                      throws ToxException
        Sets our status message
        Parameters:
        message - our new status message
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed, the message was too long, or another error occurred

      • getSelfName

                             throws ToxException
        Function to get our current name
        Returns:
        our name
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newname)
             throws ToxException
        Sets our nickname
        Parameters:
        newname - the new name to set. Maximum length is 128 bytes. This means that a name containing UTF-8 characters has a shorter character limit than one only using ASCII.
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance was killed, the name was too long, or another error occurred

      • setUserStatus

        public void setUserStatus(ToxUserStatus status)
                   throws ToxException
        Set our current ToxUserStatus.
        Parameters:
        status - the status to set
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance was killed, we tried to set our status to invalid, or an error occurred while setting status

      • addFriend

        public F addFriend(java.lang.String address,
          java.lang.String data)
                              throws ToxException,
                                     FriendExistsException
        Method used to add a friend. On success, the friend is added to the list of friends, and a reference to the friend is returned.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the friend you want to add
        data - an optional message you want to send to your friend
        Returns:
        the friend
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or an error code is returned by the native tox_addfriend call
        FriendExistsException - if the friend already exists

      • confirmRequest

        public F confirmRequest(java.lang.String address)
                                   throws ToxException,
                                          FriendExistsException
        Confirm a friend request, or add a friend to your own list without sending them a friend request. If successful, the Friend is added to the list, and a reference to the friend is returned.
        Parameters:
        address - address of the friend to add
        Returns:
        the friend
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance was killed or an error occurred when adding the friend
        FriendExistsException - if the friend already exists

      • deleteFriend

        public void deleteFriend(int friendnumber)
                  throws ToxException
        Method used to delete a friend
        Parameters:
        friendnumber - the friend to delete
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or an error occurred

      • sendMessage

        public int sendMessage(F friend,
              java.lang.String message)
                throws ToxException
        Sends a message to the specified friend. Add the message ID of the sent message to the list of sent messages of the receiving friend.
        Parameters:
        friend - the friend
        message - the message
        Returns:
        the message ID of the sent message. This is stored in the Friend's list of sent messages.
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or the message was not sent

      • sendMessage

        public int sendMessage(F friend,
              java.lang.String message,
              int messageID)
                throws ToxException
        Sends a message to the specified friend, with a specified ID
        Parameters:
        friend - the friend
        message - the message
        messageID - the message ID to use
        Returns:
        the message ID of the sent message. If you want to receive read receipts, hang on to this value.
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or the message was not sent.

      • sendAction

        public void sendAction(F friend,
              java.lang.String action)
                throws ToxException
        Sends an IRC-like /me-action to a friend
        Parameters:
        friend - the friend
        action - the action
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or the send failed

      • setSendReceipts

        public void setSendReceipts(int friendnumber,
                   boolean sendReceipts)
                     throws ToxException
        Set whether or not to send read receipts to the originator of a message once we received a message. This defaults to true, and must be disabled manually for each friend, if not required
        Parameters:
        friendnumber - the friend's number
        sendReceipts - true to send receipts, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed

      • doTox

        public void doTox()
           throws ToxException
        The main tox loop that needs to be run at least 20 times per second. When implementing this, either use it in a main loop to guarantee execution, or start an asynchronous Thread or Service to do it for you.
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed

      • bootstrap

        public void bootstrap(java.lang.String host,
             int port,
             java.lang.String pubkey)
               throws ToxException,
                      java.net.UnknownHostException
        Method used to bootstrap the client's connection.
        Parameters:
        host - Hostname or IP(v4, v6) address to connect to. If the hostname contains non-ASCII characters, convert it to punycode when calling this method.
        port - port to connect to
        pubkey - public key of the bootstrap node
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed or an invalid port was specified
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host could not be resolved or the IP address was invalid

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
                    throws ToxException
        Check if the client is connected to the DHT
        Returns:
        true if connected, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed

      • killTox

        public void killTox()
             throws ToxException
        Kills the current instance, triggering a cleanup of all internal data structures. All subsequent calls on any method in this class will result in a ToxException with ToxError.TOX_KILLED_INSTANCE as an error code.
        Throws:
        ToxException - in case the instance has already been killed

      • save

        public byte[] save()
            throws ToxException
        Save the internal messenger data to a byte array, which can be saved to a file or database
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the saved data
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance has been killed

      • refreshList

        public void refreshList()
                 throws ToxException
        Refresh the friend list, looking for new friends, status changes, name changes etc.
        Throws:
        ToxException - if the instance was killed, or an internal error occured

      • getInstanceNumber

        public int getInstanceNumber()
        If you need to pass a JTox instance around between different contexts, and are unable to pass instances directly, use this method to acquire the instance number of this instance. Once acquired, you can acquire the instance with getInstance(int).
        Returns:
        the instance number

      • getFriendList

        public FriendList<F> getFriendList()
        Returns:
        the friendlist

      • getInstance

        public static JTox<?> getInstance(int instancenumber)
        Get the instance associated with the specified instance number. This may return null if either the instance was killed, or if no instance with that number exists.
        Parameters:
        instancenumber -
        Returns:
        the associated instance

        public static byte[] getStringBytes(java.lang.String in)
        Turns the given String into an array of UTF-8 encoded bytes, also adding a nullbyte at the end for convenience
        Parameters:
        in - the String to convert
        Returns:
        a byte array

      • getByteString

        public static java.lang.String getByteString(byte[] in)
        Turns the given byte array into a UTF-8 encoded string
        Parameters:
        in - the byte array to convert
        Returns:
        an UTF-8 String based on the given byte array

        public static byte[] hexToByteArray(java.lang.String in)
        Convert a given hexadecimal String to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        in - String to convert
        Returns:
        byte array representation of the hexadecimal String
